qas.question: For how long was Spanish the official language of Galicia?
In modern times, from which year have children attended school in Galician?
What was the name of the law that enacted this?

answers.text: Lei de Normalización Lingüística ("Law of Linguistic Normalization"

context: Spanish was nonetheless the only official language in Galicia for <a0_0>more than four centuries<a0_0/>. Over the many centuries of Castilian domination, Galician faded from day-to-day use in urban areas. The period since the re-establishment of democracy in Spain—in particular since the <a2_0>Lei de Normalización Lingüística ("Law of Linguistic Normalization"<a2_0/>, Ley 3/<a1_0>1983<a1_0/>, 15 June 1983)—represents the first time since the introduction of mass education that a generation has attended school in Galician (Spanish is also still taught in Galician schools).
